ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] installing on Solaris 10
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, I don t know of any reason heritrix wouldn t work in Solaris, although I m also not aware of it being tested before. Your error message is a little

Hello,

I don't know of any reason heritrix wouldn't work in Solaris, although I'm also not aware of it being tested before. Your error message is a little peculiar because DispositionProcessor should have the property 'forceRetire'.

Difficult to say what might be going on. Which version of heritrix are you using? What happens with the default configuration? How does this sstest config differ from the default? Are there any other hints in heritrix_out.log?

Noah

On 2011-09-15 19:35 , RH wrote:
> Hi, are there any issues to note when installing on Solaris 10?
>
> We're tried installing but are having a problem.
>
> Here are some details from our sys admin running sstest:
>
> configuration: ./jobs/sstest/crawler-beans.cxml [edit]
> Job Log (more)
> 2011-09-15T17:19:29.239+10:00 SEVERE Invalid property 'forceRetire' of bean class [org.archive.crawler.postprocessor.DispositionProcessor]: No property 'forceRetire' found
> 2011-09-15T17:19:29.239+10:00 SEVERE Invalid property 'forceRetire' of bean class [org.archive.crawler.postprocessor.DispositionProcessor]: No property 'forceRetire' found
> Job is Unbuilt
> Files
> Browse Job Directory
> Configuration-referenced Paths
> build the job to discover referenced paths
> Advanced
> Scripting console
> build the job to browse bean instances
> Copy
> Copy job to as profile
>
> Here is our java version:
> java version "1.6.0_26" Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_26-b03) Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 20.1-b02, mixed mode)
